posts.html:
This is a live document that I'll update as I find more and more of these.

Pandas

InvalidIndexError: Reindexing only valid with uniquely valued Index objects" Error

Most likely you are using concat to concatenate two dataframes with different indexes.

For example, your DF1 might have a datetime index and your DF2 might have a numerical index like 1,2,3...n.

# you can use the index from the first df to create df2
df2 = pandas.DataFrame(data, columns=['max_drop', 'max_jump'],index=df.index)

Tensorflow/Keras

ValueError: Failed to find data adapter that can handle input: , ( containing values of types {""})

Awful feedback, isn't it? One of those unnecessary Google visits.

Just convert your inputs into numpy arrays, you probably forgot it. If your y or  y_train data is a list, you need to convert it to a numpy array.

TF people could simply either convert the list into a numpy array, or give the programmer the suggestion that maybe it's what they forgot.

y = np.asarray(y)

# or if you rather do it after splitting
train_y = np.asarray(train_y)
test_y = np.asarray(test_y)

ValueError: Failed to convert a NumPy array to a Tensor (Unsupported object type float)

Another cryptic message. This can be caused by so many reasons, it's hard to list everything.

Usually this problem is solved by converting the data to an numpy array, you can add the value type to reduce the probability of error:

x = np.asarray(x).astype('float32')

However, there are other problems that can cause this error, for example empty values in a string column in a pandas dataframe. In that case, filling NA values with empty strings might help.

df.fillna(value='', inplace=True)

posts.html:
Leading by Impact. Strategic Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.

Summary

Born in the university city of Coimbra, my family bought our first computer when I was 9 yrs old. This computer was slow and internet access was scarce. This meant, that unlike most of my friends, I wouldn't spend any time playing games or browsing the 90's internet. Instead, I found fun in programming scripts and my own games as a kid.

Today, I am a data scientist with experience working with +8 figure companies and market leaders around the world: retail, investing, banking, medical imaging and others.

I help business owners, entrepreneurs, founders and senior executives filter out the noise in AI and data science and invest only in truly profitable work, aligned with the existing company strategy. Through the definition of a data strategy, companies know what they should and what they shouldn't invest in when applying data science to their business.

Through my company, Enlightenment.ai, I provide a solution to the execution of the solutions to these problems.

I have worked with various market leaders in Singapore, London, Denmark and Portugal. This was only possible because I was lucky enough to be invited to apply AI as a research scientist for top research labs including MIT's Singapore lab - SMART, and CDV or amilab in Portugal, before companies were doing it.

Enlightenment.ai

Enlightenment.ai is a data science and artificial intelligence consultancy that helps companies apply data science to their business. We help companies define a data strategy, and then execute it.

The following list shows a number of relevant projects that I've helped develop.

Data Strategy

Confidencial Retail Company

Lisbon, Portugal // 2021 - 2022

I led the data strategy in a large retail company. During this time we applied the FORCE methodology I've created. We listed all data sources, defined OKRs, KPIs and initiatives. We prioritized initiatives according to the Principle of Constraints and the context of that particular company. I've also lead a number of analysis, including but not limited to consumer behaviour analysis, seasonality analysis, demand prediction together with stock analysis and prediction and a deep analysis on client's operations and quality control.

Data Strategy

Carlsberg

Copenhagen, Denmark // 2019 - 2020

I was the data strategist for a major innovation project developed by Carlsberg. Together with other colleagues from Enlightenment.ai we took large amounts of Carlsberg's data to generate relevant insights for restaurant owners. Strategically, I've helped identified relevant analysis by meeting with Carlsberg's leadership and its clients and managers from Hong Kong, Switzerland, Denmark and United Kingdom. Technically, I led a number of different analysis: identification of relevant events, identification of trends, anomaly detection, product recommendation, consumer behaviour analysis and churn analysis, to name a few.

Fraud Detection with Machine Learning

Confidential Payment Processor

Lisbon, Portugal // 2019 - 2019

I led a team of four data scientists in a major payment processor. We replaced human-made fraud detection models by data-driven machine learning models, achieving record performance. These models were trained automatically and integrated into IBM Safer Payments platform.

Data Scientist

ReachX

London, UK // 2017 - 2019

Supervision of three other data scientists. Development of data infrastructure and custom machine learning models in the financial industry. ReachX works with financial data such as the one provided by Refinitiv Eikon and Bloomberg terminal. We built anomaly detection systems, tracked news and social media sentiment, and developed a number of other models to help our clients make better decisions.

Experience

Data Science Advisor

Hire Space

London, United Kingdom // Sep 2017 - Sep 2018 // 1 yr 1 mo

As the UK's leading venue marketplace, Hire Space hired me as a consultant to provide expert advice on the application of data science and artificial intelligence (particularly machine learning) to their business.

Contract Data Scientist

Kheiron Medical

London, United Kingdom // Jan 2017 - Sep 2017 // 9 mos

Kheiron Medical is a medical company that uses state-of-the-art machine learning technologies, such as artificial neural networks, to produce top-performance medical imagining tools. During this time I've developed algorithms to detect cancer lesions using a mixture of traditional computer vision and deep learning.

Lead Data Scientist

Citizen Pace

London, United Kingdom // Sep 2015 - Dec 2016 // 1 yr 4 mos

Citizen Pace is revolutionizing the way OOH advertising works by improving both the planning of campaigns and their evaluation, making it simple to track different return metrics. The company aims to provide data-driven insights in near real-time about the preferences and types of people in a specific area and time, around cities. It does this by having a deep understanding of the movement of crowds, extracted from a variety of datasets, ranging from social networks to transportation data.

Technology Entrepreneur

Entrepreneur First

London, United Kingdom // Mar 2016 - May 2016 // 3 mos

Entrepreneur First is Europe's leading pre-seed investment program, with less than 3% acceptance rate, for technical founders who want to work on hard problems. 55% of their portfolio is educated at Oxford, Cambridge, or Imperial College London, and worked before in companies such as Google, Palantir, Amazon, Apple, Airbnb, and Uber.

Invited Research Scientist

Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) Research Center "SMART"

Singapore // Apr 2015 - Sep 2015 // 6 mos

Development of a parsimonious sensing system using Active Learning and Gaussian Processes. Development of a predictive system for events happening in Singapore and their effect on the country's transportation systems. I've built a system capable of Identifying traffic anomalies and developing a system capable of querying different search engines and automatically extracting information that would justify such anomalies.

Research Fellow

CISUC (Centre for Informatics and Systems of the University of Coimbra)

Portugal // Jul 2014 - Jul 2015 // 1 yr 1 mo

AMILAB, Cognitive and Media Systems Group, Coimbra, PortugalAMILAB, Cognitive and Media Systems Group, Coimbra, PortugalProject InfoCrowds - Information Retrieval techniques and application of active learning in the topic of crowds mobility management using social web data.

Data Scientist

SONAE

Portugal // May 2014 - Jul 2014 // 3 mos

SONAE is present in more than 60 countries, with more than 40.000 employees. CDV was working with Sonae Distribuição, the largest retailer in Portugal. A team at CDV was hired by SONAE to do some analysis on the client data they have been collecting for years. My team was exploring the data SONAE has been collecting for years to give them insights about what they could do with it. Besides interactive visualizations, we were working on a way to improve their operational inventory system and reduce the waste of perishable goods, study cannibalism within the brand and study people's buying habits.

Research Fellow

CISUC (Centre for Informatics and Systems of the University of Coimbra)

Coimbra, Portugal // Dec 2013 - May 2014 // 6 mos

Project RECARDI - Used computer vision and machine learning to build Content-based Image Retrieval (CBIR) systems.Project RECARDI - Used computer vision and machine learning to build Content-based Image Retrieval (CBIR) systems.

Research Fellow

CISUC (Centre for Informatics and Systems of the University of Coimbra)

Coimbra, Portugal // Aug 2013 - Dec 2013 // 5 mos

The objective of project SBIRC ( Style Based Image Retrieval and Classification ) was to use machine learning techniques to classify images into different styles. I was responsible for extracting the image features that would then be used to characterize each image.The objective of project SBIRC ( Style Based Image Retrieval and Classification ) was to use machine learning techniques to classify images into different styles. I was responsible for extracting the image features that would then be used to characterize each image.

Development Lead

Bark it!

Coimbra, Portugal // Feb 2013 - Sep 2013 // 8 mos

Bark it! was a technology startup backed by the Portuguese Government. During my work there I led two other computer scientists whilst creating a distributed system similar to a Domain Name Server for phone numbers. I've also worked on a solution to try to predict what phone numbers people would call at specific times and places.

Freelance Python Developer

Self-employed

Coimbra, Portugal // Sep 2012 - Jul 2013 // 11 mos

I was a freelance Python developer while I studying. I've done both websites and small private projects for individuals and small companies.

Certifications

BPMN 2.0 with Brian: A Beginner's Guide - Udemy - Issued Jul 2020

Deep Learning with Tensor - Packt Publishing - Issued Nov 2016

Computational Investing, Part I (with Distinction) - Georgia Institute of Technology - Issued Nov 2014

Networked Life (with Distinction) - University of Pennsylvania - Issued Oct 2014

Getting and Cleaning Data(with Distinction) - The Johns Hopkins University - Issued Nov 2014

Practical Machine Learning (with Distinction) - The Johns Hopkins University - Issued Sep 2014

R Programming (with Distinction) - The Johns Hopkins University - Issued Sep 2014

The Data Scientist’s Toolbox (with Distinction) - The Johns Hopkins UniversityIssued Sep 2014

Education

Bachelor and Master Degree in Computer Science // 2015

University of Coimbra, Portugal

Recommendations

Benjamin Yuan // Jan 12, 2023

Machine Learning Engineering Manager, Recommendation at TikTok

I highly recommend Manuel for any strategic role in data science and AI. As a co-founder, he demonstrated an exceptional ability to identify business opportunities and develop innovative solutions using data and AI. He is a valuable asset in any team.

Gonçalo Rieff Montalvão // May 8, 2020

Performance Analyst at Galp Commercial

I worked with Manuel at EAI in refining offerings and enhancing value creation. Manuel is a highly effective professional with an ambitious and entrepreneurial mindset!

João Nuno Correia // July 4, 2016

Assistant Professor at University of Coimbra

Manuel is an organized, responsible and pro-active person, that impressed me with his exploratory and inventive skills. During our work in the SBIRC's Image feature extractor he learned different new concepts really fast, easily understanding the work already done which allowed him to actively contribute to the project. He showed knowledge of machine learning, image and data processing skills, allied to excellent programming skills and ability to solve problems.

Adriano Vinhas // July 4, 2016

Machine Learning Engineer at Captify || PhD student at University of Coimbra

I met Manuel while we were working in the same Lab. At the time, we were both studying different machine learning techniques for image processing. Manuel's autonomy and impressing problem-solving capabilities, along with his drive for self-improvement and openness to challenges made him a fast learner and one of the best people I ever met to work in a data science team.

Shahram Mossayebi, Ph.D // July 4, 2016

Founder & CEO at Crypto Quantique

Through various discussions Manuel comes across as a knowledgeable person with strong analytical skills. I found him an expert in coding and emerging technologies such as machine learning.

Francisco Antunes // July 2, 2016

Researcher | Data Science | Machine Learning

I met Manuel at CISUC while he was a researcher there and working on his Master thesis. We were both researchers within the same research lab. We used to regularly discuss many things and help each other either regarding his work or mine. These discussions were often heavily constructive and enlightening. Manuel always proved to be very pragmatic, analytical, objective-oriented and imaginative person, which undoubtedly makes him a skilful and resourceful colleague and professional. He is also quite autonomous, as he is always able to work around unexpected problems with ease. It was a pleasure to meet and work with Manuel. I hope we can collaborate again in the future.

Stanislav Borysov // June 30, 2016

Senior Manager, Data Science at Vay

I worked with Manuel at the MIT research center SMART in Singapore and can definitely recommend him as a knowledgable person and excellent team-player. During our collaborative work on various projects related to intelligent transportation systems, Manuel showed his deep knowledge of modern machine learning techniques, including clustering, regression, text classification and natural language processing, and successfully applied them to tackle real-world problems.

Peter Kecskemethy // June 25, 2016

CEO & co-founder, PhD at Kheiron Medical

Manuel has been one of the greatest minds at EF - a definite problem solver and a great data scientist. He is the kind of person I would be very happy to work with closer.

Mariana Lourenço // June 24, 2016

Principal Data Scientist at RedLight

It's rare to come across someone like Manuel. I had the pleasure of collaborating with Manuel when we were working for MIT in Singapore. It was impressive seeing him developing inventive ways to explore and model the transport datasets we had at our disposal. He's also a very pragmatic person, which helps in a lot of situations. Manuel, either as a team member or a leader, earns my highest recommendation.

Filipe Assunção // November 6, 2015

Lead Research Scientist at OutSystems

Manuel is a self-driven researcher, making him a vital member of the team he is working with. I had the pleasure to cooperate with Manuel in the Computational Design and Visualization Lab., CISUC, where the work he developed become of huge importance for my own tasks. He developed a powerful feature extractor for image-based evolution, with which I was later capable of evolving aesthetic images, mapped from Context Free Design Grammars, using a genetic programming approach.

posts.plaintext:
Leading by Impact. Strategic Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.


Summary
Born in the university city of Coimbra, my family bought our first computer when
I was 9 yrs old. This computer was slow and internet access was scarce. This
meant, that unlike most of my friends, I wouldn't spend any time playing games
or browsing the 90's internet. Instead, I found fun in programming scripts and
my own games as a kid.

Today, I am a data scientist with experience working with +8 figure companies
and market leaders around the world: retail, investing, banking, medical imaging
and others.

I help business owners, entrepreneurs, founders and senior executives filter out
the noise in AI and data science and invest only in truly profitable work,
aligned with the existing company strategy. Through the definition of a data
strategy, companies know what they should and what they shouldn't invest in when
applying data science to their business.

Through my company, Enlightenment.ai, I provide a solution to the execution of
the solutions to these problems.

I have worked with various market leaders in Singapore, London, Denmark and
Portugal. This was only possible because I was lucky enough to be invited to
apply AI as a research scientist for top research labs including MIT's Singapore
lab - SMART, and CDV or amilab in Portugal, before companies were doing it.

Enlightenment.ai
Enlightenment.ai is a data science and artificial intelligence consultancy that
helps companies apply data science to their business. We help companies define a
data strategy, and then execute it.

The following list shows a number of relevant projects that I've helped develop.

Data Strategy
Confidencial Retail Company

Lisbon, Portugal // 2021 - 2022

I led the data strategy in a large retail company. During this time we applied
the FORCE methodology I've created. We listed all data sources, defined OKRs,
KPIs and initiatives. We prioritized initiatives according to the Principle of
Constraints and the context of that particular company. I've also lead a number
of analysis, including but not limited to consumer behaviour analysis,
seasonality analysis, demand prediction together with stock analysis and
prediction and a deep analysis on client's operations and quality control.

Data Strategy
Carlsberg

Copenhagen, Denmark // 2019 - 2020

I was the data strategist for a major innovation project developed by Carlsberg.
Together with other colleagues from Enlightenment.ai we took large amounts of
Carlsberg's data to generate relevant insights for restaurant owners.
Strategically, I've helped identified relevant analysis by meeting with
Carlsberg's leadership and its clients and managers from Hong Kong, Switzerland,
Denmark and United Kingdom. Technically, I led a number of different analysis:
identification of relevant events, identification of trends, anomaly detection,
product recommendation, consumer behaviour analysis and churn analysis, to name
a few.

Fraud Detection with Machine Learning
Confidential Payment Processor

Lisbon, Portugal // 2019 - 2019

I led a team of four data scientists in a major payment processor. We replaced
human-made fraud detection models by data-driven machine learning models,
achieving record performance. These models were trained automatically and
integrated into IBM Safer Payments platform.

Data Scientist
ReachX

London, UK // 2017 - 2019

Supervision of three other data scientists. Development of data infrastructure
and custom machine learning models in the financial industry. ReachX works with
financial data such as the one provided by Refinitiv Eikon and Bloomberg
terminal. We built anomaly detection systems, tracked news and social media
sentiment, and developed a number of other models to help our clients make
better decisions.

Experience
Data Science Advisor
Hire Space

London, United Kingdom // Sep 2017 - Sep 2018 // 1 yr 1 mo

As the UK's leading venue marketplace, Hire Space hired me as a consultant to
provide expert advice on the application of data science and artificial
intelligence (particularly machine learning) to their business.

Contract Data Scientist
Kheiron Medical

London, United Kingdom // Jan 2017 - Sep 2017 // 9 mos

Kheiron Medical is a medical company that uses state-of-the-art machine learning
technologies, such as artificial neural networks, to produce top-performance
medical imagining tools. During this time I've developed algorithms to detect
cancer lesions using a mixture of traditional computer vision and deep learning.

Lead Data Scientist
Citizen Pace

London, United Kingdom // Sep 2015 - Dec 2016 // 1 yr 4 mos

Citizen Pace is revolutionizing the way OOH advertising works by improving both
the planning of campaigns and their evaluation, making it simple to track
different return metrics. The company aims to provide data-driven insights in
near real-time about the preferences and types of people in a specific area and
time, around cities. It does this by having a deep understanding of the movement
of crowds, extracted from a variety of datasets, ranging from social networks to
transportation data.

Technology Entrepreneur
Entrepreneur First

London, United Kingdom // Mar 2016 - May 2016 // 3 mos

Entrepreneur First is Europe's leading pre-seed investment program, with less
than 3% acceptance rate, for technical founders who want to work on hard
problems. 55% of their portfolio is educated at Oxford, Cambridge, or Imperial
College London, and worked before in companies such as Google, Palantir, Amazon,
Apple, Airbnb, and Uber.

Invited Research Scientist
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) Research Center "SMART"

Singapore // Apr 2015 - Sep 2015 // 6 mos

Development of a parsimonious sensing system using Active Learning and Gaussian
Processes. Development of a predictive system for events happening in Singapore
and their effect on the country's transportation systems. I've built a system
capable of Identifying traffic anomalies and developing a system capable of
querying different search engines and automatically extracting information that
would justify such anomalies.

Research Fellow
CISUC (Centre for Informatics and Systems of the University of Coimbra)

Portugal // Jul 2014 - Jul 2015 // 1 yr 1 mo

AMILAB, Cognitive and Media Systems Group, Coimbra, PortugalAMILAB, Cognitive
and Media Systems Group, Coimbra, PortugalProject InfoCrowds - Information
Retrieval techniques and application of active learning in the topic of crowds
mobility management using social web data.

Data Scientist
SONAE

Portugal // May 2014 - Jul 2014 // 3 mos

SONAE is present in more than 60 countries, with more than 40.000 employees. CDV
was working with Sonae Distribuição, the largest retailer in Portugal. A team at
CDV was hired by SONAE to do some analysis on the client data they have been
collecting for years. My team was exploring the data SONAE has been collecting
for years to give them insights about what they could do with it. Besides
interactive visualizations, we were working on a way to improve their
operational inventory system and reduce the waste of perishable goods, study
cannibalism within the brand and study people's buying habits.

Research Fellow
CISUC (Centre for Informatics and Systems of the University of Coimbra)

Coimbra, Portugal // Dec 2013 - May 2014 // 6 mos

Project RECARDI - Used computer vision and machine learning to build
Content-based Image Retrieval (CBIR) systems.Project RECARDI - Used computer
vision and machine learning to build Content-based Image Retrieval (CBIR)
systems.

Research Fellow
CISUC (Centre for Informatics and Systems of the University of Coimbra)

Coimbra, Portugal // Aug 2013 - Dec 2013 // 5 mos

The objective of project SBIRC ( Style Based Image Retrieval and Classification
) was to use machine learning techniques to classify images into different
styles. I was responsible for extracting the image features that would then be
used to characterize each image.The objective of project SBIRC ( Style Based
Image Retrieval and Classification ) was to use machine learning techniques to
classify images into different styles. I was responsible for extracting the
image features that would then be used to characterize each image.

Bark it!

Bark it! was a technology startup backed by the Portuguese Government. During my

solution to try to predict what phone numbers people would call at specific
times and places.

Freelance Python Developer
Self-employed

Coimbra, Portugal // Sep 2012 - Jul 2013 // 11 mos

I was a freelance Python developer while I studying. I've done both websites and
small private projects for individuals and small companies.

BPMN 2.0 with Brian: A Beginner's Guide - Udemy - Issued Jul 2020

Deep Learning with Tensor - Packt Publishing - Issued Nov 2016

Computational Investing, Part I (with Distinction) - Georgia Institute of

University of Coimbra, Portugal

posts.html:
I've bought a ticket to Dubai throught Emirates. Because my company paid for it, I needed an invoice to show the expense.

Useless web

The first thing I've tried doing is using the official website to issue an invoice.

This didn't work. The website does not issue invoices.

Useless chat

The second thing I've done was use the live chat provided on the website.

I got answered by someone called "Rebecca". They first say they "We don't generate invoices", later they say that is done, for "some contries", but provides no information about it.

After much talk, she finally gives me an email I should contact to get the invoice, this email is ekportugal@emirates.com.

Useless email

This is how my conversation with email went:

  • 2023/05/30 Requested an invoice to be issued.
  • 2023/05/01 Got an answer saying they wouldn't issue an invoice because they verified I was asking its emission as an individual, not a company (This is wrong as I provided a company VAT number)
  • 2023/06/07 Requested the invoice to be issued again, showing them it is indeed a company VAT number.
  • 2023/06/16 Over two weeks pass after my initial request. After not receiving an answer, I've sent another email, asking, again, for them to send the invoice as fast as possible.
  • 2023/06/16 I get an email back asking for the name of the company.
  • 2023/06/16 Company name provided. No answer.
  • 2023/06/19 Still no answer, no invoice. Provided again with the company name and VAT number.
  • 2023/06/19 Still no answer, no invoice. Provided YET again with the company name and VAT number.

(Mostly) Useless call support

The person who I've been emailing with has a signature with a phone number. The phone number is +351 213500500 and it says "Lisbon Town Office".

Let's try calling them, I thought:

  • 2023/06/19: I press 5 for "Financial Department". My call gets forwarded to some other number. It goes to voicemail, according to the voicemail message, the number I was forwarded to seems to be 215 863 218.
  • 2023/06/19: I press 4 for "Commercial Department". My call gets disconnected.
  • 2023/06/20: I press 6 for "Administrative Department". My call gets forwarded and I get the message "O número para o qual ligou não está atribuido.", in other words "The number you called is not assigned".
  • 2023/06/20: I press 5 for "Financial Department". A lady picks up. I explain the situation, and she says she is on vacation, and that the team is small and some of them are on vacation too. I tell her "But look, I asked for the invoice 20 days ago.", she is understanding and tells me it will be issued by the end of the week. She also tells me that for accountability purposes, there's an exception in the Portuguese law that states that the tickets and receipts can be used to justify exists and that that is not known even by most accountants, but that they do it, for customer experience.

Conclusion

I'll update this as soon as I get an answer.

<script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/ace/1.4.14/ace.js"

<script>
        var editor;
        $('.editor').each(function (index) {
            editor = ace.edit(this);
            editor.setTheme("ace/theme/dawn");
            editor.getSession().setMode("ace/mode/csharp");

            let linestart = parseInt(this.dataset['linestart'])
            if (linestart) {
                editor.setOption("firstLineNumber", linestart);
            }
            else {
                editor.setOption("firstLineNumber", 1)
            }
 			
            editor.setOptions({
                maxLines: 25
            });
            editor.setOption("indentedSoftWrap", true);
            editor.getSession().setUseWrapMode(true);
            editor.setReadOnly(true);
            editor.setShowPrintMargin(false);
            editor.$blockScrolling = Infinity;
        });
    
    	
        $('.python-editor').each(function (index) {
            editor = ace.edit(this);
            editor.setTheme("ace/theme/dawn");
            editor.getSession().setMode("ace/mode/python");

            let linestart = parseInt(this.dataset['linestart'])
            if (linestart) {
                editor.setOption("firstLineNumber", linestart);
            }
            else {
                editor.setOption("firstLineNumber", 1)
            }
 			
            editor.setOptions({
                maxLines: 25
            });
            editor.setOption("indentedSoftWrap", true);
            editor.getSession().setUseWrapMode(true);
            editor.setReadOnly(true);
            editor.setShowPrintMargin(false);
            editor.$blockScrolling = Infinity;
        });
    
</script>
